metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4408 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the dcerpc_read_ncacn_packet_done function in librpc/rpc/dcerpc_util.c in winbindd in Samba 3.x before 3.6.22, 4.0.x before 4.0.13, and 4.1.x before 4.1.3 allows remote AD domain controllers to execute arbitrary code via an invalid fragment length in a DCE-RPC packet.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4408` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libnss-winbind - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libpam-winbind - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libsmbclient - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libwbclient0 - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
python-samba - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
registry-tools - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-common - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-common-bin - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-libs - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-testsuite - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
smbclient - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
winbind - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1').
